contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|pink}} {{TOCright}} '''[[Pink]]''' is a pale red color. '''Pink''', '''Pinks''', or '''Pink's''' may also refer to: ==Music== * [[Pink (singer)]], stage name of musician Alecia Moore. (also spelled ''P!nk'') * [[Pink (album)|''Pink'' (album)]], by Boris * [[Pink (song)|"Pink" (song)]], by Aerosmith * [[Pink (Four Tet album)|''Pink'' (Four Tet album)]] ==Television== * [[Pinks]], a racing show * [[Pink TV (France)]], a gay-oriented channel * [[Pink TV (US)]], a pornography channel * [[RTV Pink]], a Serbian network ==Film== * [[Pink (film)|''Pink'' (film)]], a 2011 Korean film * ''Pink'', a film at the [[2007 Toronto International Film Festival]] * A character in ''[[Pink Floydâ€”The Wall]]'' ==Periodicals== * [[Pink (business magazine)|''Pink'' (business magazine)]], for women * [[Pink (LGBT magazine)|''Pink'' (LGBT magazine)]], for lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender people ==Technology== * [[Microsoft Kin]], a mobile phone line (originally codenamed Project Pink) * [[Taligent]], an Apple/IBM software project ==Other uses== * [[The Pink]] or ''The Carnation'', a German fairy tale collected by the Brothers Grimm * [[Pink (surname)]], and people with the name * [[Pink (flower)]], a type of plant *[[Pink, Jessamine County, Kentucky]] * [[Pink, Oklahoma]] *[[Pink, West Virginia]] * [[Pink (novel)|''Pink'' (novel)]], by Gus Van Sant * [[Pink (ship)]], a type of watercraft * [[Pink (courier service)]], a social project * [[PINK!]], the youth wing of the Dutch political party Party for the Animals * [[Pink's Hot Dogs]], a restaurant * [[Pinko]], a communist sympathizer * Traditional attire in [[fox hunting]] * A clothing line by [[Victoria's Secret]] * [[P.i.n.k Vodka]], a Dutch vodka <!-- Please consider adding slang meanings of "pink" to wiktionary, not here, unless the linked-to article specifically mentions the slang term. --> ==See also== * {{Intitle|Pink}} * [[Pinking (disambiguation)]] * [[Pinky (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation}}
